metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11675 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The groonga-httpd package 6.1.5-1 for Debian sets the /var/log/groonga ownership to the groonga account, which might let local users obtain root access because of unsafe interaction with logrotate. For example, an attacker can exploit a race condition to insert a symlink from /var/log/groonga/httpd to /etc/bash_completion.d. NOTE: this is an issue in the Debian packaging of the Groonga HTTP server.

criterions.comment: groonga package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-2').
